p: The Cavalieri method was applied to estimate the total volume of the uterine horn. To estimate the volume, the uterine horn was divided into 8–12 parallel sections with a specified distance ( t). After tissue processing, the sections were placed in paraffin blocks. Serial 5‐μm‐thick sections were taken using a microtome and stained with Hematoxylin and Eosin (H&E) (Merck company, Germany) method.
